sen.j: 公卿補任（くぎょうぶにん）は、日本の史料で朝廷の歴代の職員録。
sen.e: Kugyo-bunin is a historical material and the directory of successive personnel in the Imperial Court.
Kugyo-bunin is a historical material of Japan and the directory of successive personnel in the Imperial Court.
sen.cmt: 「日本の」が訳漏れでしたので、追記致しました。
sen.e: Kugyo-bunin is a historical material of Japan and the directory of successive personnel in the Imperial Court.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 神武天皇の時代から明治元年まで各年毎に、従三位以上で太政大臣・摂政・関白・左大臣・右大臣・内大臣・大納言・中納言・参議・非参議のいわゆる公卿に相当する者の名を官職順に列挙してある。
sen.e: From the age of the Emperor Jinmu to the year of 1868, it listed names of so-called Kugyo (the top court officials) including Daijo-daijin (Grand Minister), Sessho Kampaku (regent and chief adviser to the Emperor), Sadaijin(the Minister of the Left), Udaijin(the Minister of the Right), Naidaijin (the Minister of the Interior), Dainagon (Major Counselor), Chunagon (Middle Counselor), Sangi (advisor on the Council of State), and Hisangi (advisor at large) whose rank were Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) or higher.

Each and every year from the time of the Emperor Jinmu to 1868, it listed names of those who held the rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) or higher which were the so-called Kugyo (the top court officials) including Daijo-daijin (Grand Minister), Sessho Kampaku (regent and chief adviser to the Emperor), Sadaijin (the Minister of the Left), Udaijin (the Minister of the Right), Naidaijin (the Minister of the Interior), Dainagon (Major Counselor), Chunagon (Middle Counselor), Sangi (advisor on the Council of State), and Hisangi (advisor at large).
sen.cmt: ()前に半角スペースを入れ、訳漏れである「各年毎」を追記致しました。
sen.e: Each and every year from the time of the Emperor Jinmu to 1868, it listed names of those who held the rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) or higher which were the so-called Kugyo (the top court officials) including Daijo-daijin (Grand Minister), Sessho Kampaku (regent and chief adviser to the Emperor), Sadaijin (the Minister of the Left), Udaijin (the Minister of the Right), Naidaijin (the Minister of the Interior), Dainagon (Major Counselor), Chunagon (Middle Counselor), Sangi (advisor on the Council of State), and Hisangi (advisor at large).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 記載される人名には本姓が使われる。
sen.e: Real family names were written in the list.

sen.j: 藤原氏は、「藤原○○」ではなく略して「藤○○」と記載された。
sen.e: The names of Fujiwara families were written as 'FUJI XX' for short, not 'FUJIWARA XX'.
The names of the Fujiwara families were abbreviated as 'FUJI XX' and were not written as 'FUJIWARA XX'.
sen.cmt: より自然な表現に修正致しました。

sen.j: 各人の名の下には、生没年、昇叙・任官などの事歴を付記している。
sen.e: Below the names, years of birth and death, personal records such as promotion and appointment were written in addition.
Below the names of each person, years of birth and death, personal records such as promotion and appointment were written in addition.

sen.j: 公卿補任の作者は未詳であり成立年代も不明であるが、「歴運記」を基に弘仁以後の分を書き足されていったものと考えられる。
sen.e: The age and authorship of Kugyo-bunin are both unclear, but it is believed to have been made by adding names after Konin era to 'Rekiunki'.
The authorship and the time when Kugyo-bunin came into existence has not yet been ascertained, but it is believed to be based on 'Rekiunki' and names had been added from the time of Konin.
sen.cmt: 「を基に」が訳漏れでしたので、補いました。
sen.e: The authorship and the time when Kugyo-bunin came into existence has not yet been ascertained, but it is believed to be based on 'Rekiunki' and names had been added from the time of Konin.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 後年の詳細な尻付（しつけ）を伴った形態しての本書の成立は、応和から正暦あたりとみられている。
sen.e: Establishment of the book as one with detailed personal record, is believed to be around Owa to Shoryaku era.
Establishment of Kugyo-bunin in the form of a book with a detailed personal record of the later years is believed to be around Owa to Shoryaku era.

sen.e: Establishment of Kugyo-bunin in the form of a book with a detailed personal record of the later years is believed to be around Owa to Shoryaku era.

sen.j: なお非参議の項は、長和以後に補足されていったとみられている。

sen.j: 任官についてもっとも纏まった史料ではあるが、平安時代前期における記事の不正確さや政治的な事情から書き直し（遡った期日での任官など）が行われた部分もあるといわれている。
sen.e: This is the most coherent historical material about appointment, but some parts of it is said to be rewritten (appointment on retroactive date etc.) due to inaccuracy in the article of the later Heian period and political reasons.
